result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Norman A. Mason

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt:
8:31 AM/Rm. 301/Prosecuting attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Norman Mason in court.  Attorney Cheryl Marie Gill appeared by video for Norman Mason.  Attorneys and Court Reporter by Zoom.  Court calls 20-CF-170, 22-CF-74, 21-CF-243, 21-CF-61.  Def. does not have an attorney in 22-CF-74.  Court has reviewed competency report.  Report indicates Def. is not competent but likely to become competent and recommends out patient treatment.  Parties stipulate to findings and recommendations.  Court orders Def. comply with competency restoration program and take all medications recommended.  Off the record for scheduling.  Back on record/Review 11-22-22/1:30 p.m.  Def. advised to contact public defender to have attorney appointed on 22-CF-74.  Victim rights complied with.  Victim makes statement to Court.  Recess 8:46 a.m.
Review hearing scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Cover Sheet for Confidential Records
Routed to JA

11:47 AM Defendant Norman A. Mason in court with Attorney Cheryl Gills.  Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 22CF74, 21CF61, 21CF243, 20CF170. Attny Gills appears specially on 22CF74 and defendant needs to contact PD.  22CF74: Initial Appearance - State heard on bond, recommends $1,000 cash with conditions he have no contact with victim in three pending CF files. Def. heard on bond. Attny Gill heard on bond. The Court orders $400 bond with condition no contact with victim. Def. wants to waive P.H. on 21CF61 and 21CF243 and have P.H. on 20CF170. Waiver of prelim reviewed. Attny Gills requests competency evaluation. Court hears from M.H. Court gives counsel options, both request evaluation. The Court orders competency evaluation. All matters to be rescheduled. Court orders Def. to keep address current with COC. All matters to be heard on July 11 at 11 a.m.  Adjourned initial appearance on 22CF74; STC on all  others.
